summary: The "joint committee on EU matters" serves as a crucial interlocutor in the EU's regulatory framework, facilitating discussions between various stakeholders, including employers and civil servants. This committee aims to strengthen representativeness and sustain a collaborative environment for elaboration on policy ideas. It plays a vital role in the recruitment and staffing of EU institutions, ensuring that qualifications and seniority are accurately acknowledged. The committee also endeavors to widen the scope of discussions, promoting conciliation and arbitration on contentious issues. By advocating for liberalization and addressing pecuniary concerns, it supports the efficient functioning of the EU's regulatory landscape.
